body_html:
No, unfortunately. I was not able to get this working in TF or Theano, and am now working on trying to implement my algorithm in Pytorch instead. It looks as though the tensorflow architecture is just not properly suited for non-standard (anything but one gradient evaluation at the current point, per iteration) optimization.

No, unfortunately. I was not able to get this working in TF or Theano, and
am now working on trying to implement my algorithm in Pytorch instead. It
looks as though the tensorflow architecture is just not properly suited for
non-standard (anything but one gradient evaluation at the current point,
per iteration) optimization.

body:
No, unfortunately. I was not able to get this working in TF or Theano, and
am now working on trying to implement my algorithm in Pytorch instead. It
looks as though the tensorflow architecture is just not properly suited for
non-standard (anything but one gradient evaluation at the current point,
per iteration) optimization.
